name: artificer
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
old use a skilled craftsman (= someone who makes things): The production of religious artefacts in Celtic society called for highly skilled designers and artificers.
UK a skilled mechanic (= someone who repairs engines) in the army, navy, or air force: His father was a Royal Navy engine room artificer.
More examplesFewer examplesWilliam Nicholl was employed until 1844 as an artificer in the trade of Wheelwright.The document mentions sail makers, coach makers, carpenters, bricklayers, and "artificers of divers other arts".The Platoon Commander and the Weapons Artificer are studying the bits of broken and twisted metal.The Chief Engineroom Artificer showed him the purpose of all the machinery, valves and pipes on board the submarine.
